item.name: Bullet Points and Lists Format Test

body.raw:
{
    "text": "# Patient Health Summary

## Medical History
* **Hypertension**: Diagnosed in 2018
* **Type 2 Diabetes**: Diagnosed in 2019
  * HbA1c: 7.2% (last checked 2023-05-15)
  * Currently managed with Metformin 1000mg twice daily
* **Allergies**:
  * Penicillin - Severe rash
  * Shellfish - Anaphylaxis

## Current Medications
| Medication | Dosage | Frequency | Purpose |
|------------|--------|-----------|---------|
| Lisinopril | 10mg | Once daily | Hypertension |
| Metformin | 1000mg | Twice daily | Diabetes |
| Aspirin | 81mg | Once daily | Cardiac prophylaxis |

## Recommended Follow-up
1. Schedule endocrinology appointment within 3 months
2. Blood pressure monitoring weekly
3. Complete lipid panel at next visit",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "es",
    "domain": "healthcare",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "anthropic",
    "model": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022"
}

{
    "text": "# Property Insurance Policy

## Coverage Summary

* **Building Coverage**: $250,000
* **Personal Property**: $125,000
* **Liability**: $300,000
* **Deductible**: $1,000

## Exclusions

This policy does NOT cover losses resulting from:

1. Flood damage
2. Earthquake damage
3. Intentional acts
4. War or nuclear hazard

## Claims Process

In the event of a loss:

1. Contact agent within 24 hours
2. Document all damages with photographs
3. Complete claim form available at www.example.com/claims
4. Provide requested documentation:
   - Proof of ownership
   - Estimated value
   - Police report (if applicable)

## Premium Schedule

| Payment Option | Amount | Due Date |
|---------------|--------|----------|
| Annual | $1,200 | January 1 |
| Semi-annual | $625 | Jan 1 & Jul 1 |
| Quarterly | $325 | Jan/Apr/Jul/Oct 1 |",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "zh",
    "domain": "insurance",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "openai",
    "model": "gpt-4o"
}

item.name: Insurance Code Blocks Test - Claude 3.5 Haiku

body.raw:
{
    "text": "# Policy Calculation Guidelines

## Premium Formula

```
premium = base_rate * age_factor * coverage_factor * risk_factor

where:
  base_rate = $500
  age_factor = 1 + ((age - 25) * 0.02) [minimum 1.0]
  coverage_factor = coverage_amount / 100000
  risk_factor = 1.0 (standard), 1.3 (high risk), 0.9 (low risk)
```

## Deductible Options

| Option | Deductible | Premium Discount |
|--------|------------|------------------|
| Low | $500 | 0% |
| Standard | $1,000 | 10% |
| High | $2,500 | 25% |
| Maximum | $5,000 | 40% |

## Coverage Limits

* Minimum: $50,000
* Maximum: $1,000,000
* Recommended: 10x annual income",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "de",
    "domain": "insurance",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "anthropic",
    "model": "claude-3-5-haiku-20241022"
}

{
    "text": "# Treatment Protocol: Acute Coronary Syndrome

## Initial Assessment (0-10 minutes)

1. **Vital Signs**
   * Blood pressure: Target <140/90 mmHg
   * Heart rate: Monitor for tachycardia/bradycardia
   * Oxygen saturation: Maintain >94%

2. **Immediate Interventions**
   * Oxygen therapy if saturation <94%
   * Aspirin 325mg (chewed)
   * Nitroglycerin 0.4mg SL (if SBP >90 mmHg)
   * Morphine 2-4mg IV (for pain unresponsive to nitrates)

## Diagnostic Pathway

| Test | Timing | Purpose |
|------|--------|---------|
| 12-lead ECG | Immediate (<10 min) | ST-elevation identification |
| Cardiac biomarkers | 0h, 3h, 6h | Confirm myocardial injury |
| Complete blood count | Initial | Baseline hematologic status |
| Basic metabolic panel | Initial | Electrolyte/renal function |
| Chest X-ray | When stable | Cardiac size, pulmonary congestion |

## STEMI Protocol

```
If ECG shows ST-elevation ≥1mm in ≥2 contiguous leads OR
new LBBB with symptoms:

1. Activate cardiac catheterization team
2. Goal: Door-to-balloon time <90 minutes
3. If PCI not available within 120 minutes, consider fibrinolysis
   (if no contraindications)
```

> **NOTE**: Document absolute/relative contraindications to thrombolysis before administration!

## Medication Dosing Chart

* **Antiplatelets**:
  * Aspirin: 325mg initial, then 81mg daily
  * Clopidogrel: 600mg loading, then 75mg daily
  * Ticagrelor: 180mg loading, then in 90mg BID

* **Anticoagulation**:
  * Unfractionated Heparin: 60 units/kg bolus (max 4,000 units), then 12 units/kg/hr (max 1,000 units/hr)
  * Enoxaparin: 1mg/kg SC q12h (reduce to 0.75mg/kg if age ≥75)",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "ja",
    "domain": "healthcare",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "google",
    "model": "gemini-2.0-flash"
}

{
    "text": "# Insurance Claim Processing Guide

## Required Documentation

* **Claim Form** (Form INS-101)
* **Proof of Loss**
  * Photos of damage
  * Repair estimates from licensed contractors
  * Police report (if applicable)
* **Policy Information**
  * Policy number
  * Coverage verification

## Claims Timeline

| Stage | Timeline | Responsible Party |
|-------|----------|-------------------|
| Initial Report | Within 48 hours of incident | Policyholder |
| Claim Assignment | 1-2 business days | Claims Department |
| Initial Assessment | 3-5 business days | Claims Adjuster |
| Documentation Review | 5-10 business days | Claims Processor |
| Decision | 15-30 business days | Senior Adjuster |
| Payment Processing | 5-7 business days after approval | Finance Department |

## Appeal Process

1. **File Written Appeal**
   * Submit Form APP-202 within 30 days of decision
   * Include any new supporting documentation
   * Specify the grounds for appeal

2. **Appeal Review**
   * Independent review by Appeal Committee
   * May request additional information
   * Decision within 45 days

3. **External Review**
   * Available if internal appeal is denied
   * Must request within 60 days of appeal decision
   * Conducted by independent third party

> **Important**: All communications regarding claims should be documented in writing. Verbal discussions should be followed up with email confirmation.",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "es",
    "domain": "insurance",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "groq",
    "model": "llama-3.3-70b-versatile"
}

{
    "text": "# Portable Patient Monitor: Technical Specifications

## Display Characteristics

| Feature | Specification |
|---------|---------------|
| Size | 10.4" diagonal |
| Resolution | 1024 x 768 pixels |
| Type | LED, capacitive touch |
| Brightness | 500 cd/m² |
| Viewing Angle | 178° (H/V) |

## Monitoring Parameters

* **ECG**
  * Leads: 3/5-lead capability
  * Heart Rate Range: 15-350 BPM
  * Accuracy: ±1 BPM or ±1%, whichever is greater
  * Arrhythmia Detection: 20+ classifications

* **SpO₂**
  * Range: 0-100%
  * Accuracy: ±2% (70-100%), ±3% (50-69%)
  * Pulse Rate Range: 25-240 BPM

* **NIBP**
  * Method: Oscillometric
  * Range: 10-270 mmHg
  * Accuracy: ±3 mmHg or ±2%, whichever is greater

## Power Specifications

```
Operating Voltage: 100-240 VAC, 50/60 Hz
Battery Type: Lithium-ion, 11.1V, 4400mAh
Battery Life: 5 hours typical operation
Charging Time: <4 hours to 90% capacity
```

## Environmental Parameters

1. **Operating Conditions**
   * Temperature: 5°C to 40°C (41°F to 104°F)
   * Humidity: 15-95% RH, non-condensing
   * Altitude: -500 to 4,600 meters (-1,600 to 15,000 feet)

2. **Storage/Transport Conditions**
   * Temperature: -20°C to 60°C (-4°F to 140°F)
   * Humidity: 10-95% RH, non-condensing

> **WARNING**: This device is not suitable for use in the presence of flammable anesthetics or in MRI environments.",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "zh",
    "domain": "healthcare",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "deepseek",
    "model": "deepseek-chat"
}

{
    "text": "# Insurance Terminology Glossary

## Policy Components

* **Premium**: The amount paid by the policyholder for coverage
* **Deductible**: Amount the insured must pay before insurance benefits begin
* **Co-insurance**: Percentage of costs shared between insurer and insured
* **Out-of-pocket maximum**: The most an insured will pay during the policy period

## Policy Types

| Policy Type | Description | Typical Coverage |
|------------|-------------|------------------|
| Term Life | Coverage for specific time period | Death benefit only |
| Whole Life | Lifetime coverage with investment component | Death benefit + cash value |
| Health | Medical expense coverage | Preventive care, illness, injury |
| Auto | Vehicle-related liability and damages | Liability, collision, comprehensive |
| Homeowners | Residence and personal property protection | Dwelling, liability, personal property |

## Claims Terminology

1. **Claim**: Formal request for payment from an insurance company
2. **Adjuster**: Person who investigates and settles claims
3. **Appraisal**: Evaluation of property damage or value
4. **Subrogation**: Insurer's right to recover costs from third party
5. **Exclusion**: Specific condition or circumstance not covered

## Legal Concepts

```
Insurable Interest: Financial interest in the insured person/property
Material Misrepresentation: False statements affecting underwriting
Utmost Good Faith: Obligation to disclose all relevant information
Indemnity: Principle of returning insured to pre-loss condition
```

> **Note**: This glossary is for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal advice or modify any policy provisions.",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "fr",
    "domain": "insurance",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "cohere",
    "model": "command-r-plus-08-2024"
}

{
    "text": "# Clinical Trial Protocol Summary

## Study Design

* **Study Type**: Phase III, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled
* **Population**: Adults 18-75 years with moderate to severe hypertension
* **Allocation**: 1:1 (active:placebo)
* **Duration**: 52 weeks (12-week treatment + 40-week follow-up)
* **Sample Size**: 500 participants (250 per arm)

## Inclusion Criteria

1. Systolic BP ≥140 mmHg or Diastolic BP ≥90 mmHg
2. Previously diagnosed essential hypertension
3. Stable on current antihypertensive regimen for ≥4 weeks
4. Willing to comply with study procedures

## Exclusion Criteria

| Criteria | Details |
|----------|---------|
| Secondary hypertension | Any etiology |
| Recent cardiovascular event | Within 6 months of screening |
| Severe renal impairment | eGFR <30 mL/min/1.73m² |
| Hepatic dysfunction | ALT or AST >3x ULN |
| Pregnancy/Breastfeeding | Women of childbearing potential must use contraception |

## Study Procedures

```
Screening (Days -28 to -1):
  - Medical history
  - Physical examination
  - Vital signs
  - Clinical laboratory tests
  - 12-lead ECG

Randomization (Day 0):
  - Confirm eligibility
  - Baseline assessments
  - Dispense study medication

Treatment Period (Weeks 1-12):
  - Visits at Weeks 2, 4, 8, 12
  - Assess vital signs, adverse events
  - Medication adherence
  - Laboratory tests at Weeks 4 and 12
```

## Endpoints

* **Primary**: Change from baseline in mean 24-hour ambulatory SBP at Week 12
* **Secondary**:
  * Proportion of patients achieving BP control (<130/80 mmHg)
  * Change in clinic BP measurements
  * Change in quality of life scores
  * Incidence of adverse events

> **Important Safety Monitoring**: All participants will be monitored for hypotension, syncope, electrolyte abnormalities, and renal function deterioration throughout the study period.",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "de",
    "domain": "healthcare",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "huggingface",
    "model": "mistralai/Mistral-7B-Instruct-v0.3"
}

{
    "text": "# Patient Health Summary

## Medical History
* **Hypertension**: Diagnosed in 2018
* **Type 2 Diabetes**: Diagnosed in 2019
  * HbA1c: 7.2% (last checked 2023-05-15)
  * Currently managed with Metformin 1000mg twice daily
* **Allergies**:
  * Penicillin - Severe rash
  * Shellfish - Anaphylaxis

## Current Medications
| Medication | Dosage | Frequency | Purpose |
|------------|--------|-----------|---------|
| Lisinopril | 10mg | Once daily | Hypertension |
| Metformin | 1000mg | Twice daily | Diabetes |
| Aspirin | 81mg | Once daily | Cardiac prophylaxis |

## Recommended Follow-up
1. Schedule endocrinology appointment within 3 months
2. Blood pressure monitoring weekly
3. Complete lipid panel at next visit",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "es",
    "domain": "healthcare",
    "quality_level": "high",
    "preserve_formatting": false,
    "provider": "anthropic",
    "model": "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022"

item.name: High Quality vs Medium Quality Format Test

body.raw:
{
    "text": "# Insurance Claim Process

## Required Documentation

* **Claim Form**: Must be completed in full
* **Proof of Loss**: Original receipts, estimates
* **Photos**: Clear images of all damage
* **Police Report**: For theft, vandalism (if applicable)

## Process Timeline

| Step | Timeframe | Notes |
|------|-----------|-------|
| Submit Claim | Within 30 days of incident | All documentation required |
| Initial Review | 1-3 business days | Claim number will be assigned |
| Adjuster Contact | 3-5 business days | May require property inspection |
| Damage Assessment | 5-10 business days | Additional documentation may be requested |
| Claim Decision | 10-15 business days | Approval or denial notification |
| Payment Processing | 5-7 business days after approval | Direct deposit or check options |

## Appeal Process

1. Request review within 30 days of decision
2. Provide additional documentation if available
3. Independent review conducted within 15 business days
4. Final determination communicated in writing",
    "source_language": "en",
    "target_language": "fr",
    "domain": "insurance",
    "quality_level": "medium",
    "preserve_formatting": true,
    "provider": "openai",
    "model": "gpt-4o"
}
